newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-PRESS DIGEST-Australian Sports News - Dec 16.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-PRESS DIGEST-Australian Sports News - Dec 16.

text.p: (Compiled for Reuters by Media Monitors)
THE AUSTRALIAN

The one-day international cricket match between Australia and Pakistan in Adelaide yesterday finally gave Australia's cricketing public what they have been waiting for all summer - a close finish. The Pakistanis, who claim to be the world's best, defeated Australia by 12 runs after an enthusiastic performance by off-spinner Saqlain Mushtaq. Page 1.

Underrated defender Adam Ciantar scored the only goal in a tough game against Ericsson Cup National Soccer League champions Melbourne Knights to help snap UTS Olympic out of the doldrums at Sydney's Belmore Sports Ground last night. Page 27.

Following a move by wealthy Tasmanian businessman Allen Hansen, the managing director of Tasmanian Seafoods, to create Pro Basketball Club Tasmania and underwrite the entry of a Tasmanian team in the National Basketball League, the island State is hoping o gain readmission to the NBL for the inaugural summer season in 1998. Page 27.
THE SYDNEY MORNING HERALD

After not letting his emotions get the better of him despite a couple of early bogeys, Tamworth golfer Anthony Painter shot a final-round, one-over 73 for a two-shot victory over Sydney's Matthew Ecob in yesterday's A$200,000 Coolum Classic. Page 28.

In response to an article in Rupert Murdoch's Sunday Telegraph newspaper yesterday which claimed Australian Rugby League chairman Ken Arthurson had given his blessing to former Canterbury boss Peter Moore joining Super League, Arthurson complained that historical revisionism by News Ltd would undermine the peace process with the ARL. Page 29.

Darren Beadman's manager John Kerwick said yesterday the jockey was resting after withdrawing from the Jockeys' Challenge in Melbourne because of a virus. Kerwick said it was a recurrence of a virus Beadman suffered in Hong Kong last week and he hoped to be fit to ride at Canterbury on Wednesday. Page 31.
THE AGE

The VRC has closed the Flemington track for racing until mid-February after recent track maintenance to the famous Flemington straight left an alarming, and subsequently dangerous, bias to the outside section of the course. The VRC will transfer its three January dates and the February 1 meeting to Moonee Valley and Sandown. Page Sports 2.

With only three men from the Atlanta Olympics on tour, Australia collected the wooden spoon at the six-nation Champions Trophy men's hockey tournament in Madras yesterday, crashing to a 5-2 defeat by Spain. The inexperienced team failed to win a match in the competition. Page Sports 2.

According to Wisden, Australia will assume outright leadership of the nine Test-playing nations, ahead of South Africa and the West Indies who currently share the top billing with Australia, if it defeats the West Indies in Melbourne to retain the Frank Worrell Trophy in the Boxing Day Test. Page Sports 8.
THE HERALD SUN

Twenty-year-old world junior champion Joanne King was yesterday celebrating her come-from-behind win in the Australian sprint distance championships at Elwood after winning the 750m swim / 20km cycle / 5km run championship in one hour and .03 seconds over Nicole Andronicus. Page 102.

As part of the changes to the 12-man New South Wales squad for the Sheffield Shield match against Queensland at the Gabba starting on Thursday, Test fast-bowler Glenn McGrath will play his first match for the Blues this season after being named yesterday. Page 101.
THE DAILY TELEGRAPH

Former world champion Trevor Barnabus, who won the world title in 1988, sailed with his 17-year-old son on the Omega Smeg/2UE skiff to win the New South Wales 18 Footer titles - sailed out of the Australian League at Double Bay. Page 29.

After being told by principal clubs the matter of a rise in riding fees would not be discussed until the next meeting of the Principal Clubs on March 12, representatives from jockey associations around Australia will conduct a telephone link-up on Wednesday to form a strategy to win an increase. Page 29.

Australia's Olympic prospects have been boosted after the Australian Olympic Committee, the Sydney Organising Committee for the Olympic Games and the Federal Government joined forces to double the funding available to help Aboriginal and Torres Strait Island sports people to A$100,000. Page 33.
